p: Results of the growth inhibitory effect of CLEO on some bacteria are demonstrated in Fig. 3. With the maximum growth of 14%, S. aureus was more affected after 24 h exposure with CLEO at a concentration of 8.00 mg. mL –1; observed growth for three other bacteria was ~ 60%. Antibacterial effect (MIC) of CLEO on E. coli, K. pneumoniae, P. aeruginosa and S. aureus was reported previously. These values were 6.4, 12.8, 12.8 and 12.8 mg.mL –1, respectively ( 22).
